sandy.materials.attributes.MediumAttributes

type
class
extends
AAttributes
This attribute provides very basic simulation of partially opaque medium. You can use this attribute to achieve wide range of effects (e.g., fog, Rayleigh scattering, light attached to camera, etc). @author makc @author Niel Drummond - haXe port @author Russell Weir - haXe port @version 3.1 @date 01.12.2007

Constructor

new(p_nColor : UInt, ?p_oFadeFrom : sandy.core.data.Point3D, ?p_oFadeTo : sandy.core.data.Point3D, ?p_nBlurAmount : Float)
parameters:
p_nColor Medium color
p_oFadeTo Attenuation vector (500 pixels beyond the screen by default).
p_oFadeFrom Transparent point (at the screen by default).
p_nBlurAmount Maximum amount of blur to add
see:
sandy.core.data.Point3D
Creates a new MediumAttributes object.

Instance Variables Hide Inherited Show Inherited

blurAmount : Float

Maximum amount of blur to add. Warning: this feature is very expensive when shape useSingleContainer is false.

color(__getColor,__setColor) : UInt

Medium color (32-bit value) at the point given by fadeFrom + fadeTo. If this value is transparent, color gradient will be extrapolated beyond that point.

fadeFrom : sandy.core.data.Point3D

Transparent point in wx, wy and wz coordinates.

fadeTo(__getFadeTo,__setFadeTo) : sandy.core.data.Point3D

Attenuation vector. This is the vector from transparent point to opaque point.

flags(__getFlags,null) : Int

inherited from sandy.materials.attributes.AAttributes
Returns the specific flags of this attribute.
